Portal 2 is an expanded version of Portal 1. The basic physics puzzles are the same. You move though various maps that you have to navigate using a handheld device that effectively tunnels you between locations. The added features of Portal 2 are multiplayer co-op maps (excellent fun!) and full compatability with the Steam workshop so that you can play nearly endless user designed maps.

Why aren't you playing this game right now? : )

For my full review on this game, make sure to read my portal 1 review! I absolutely loved this game, the gameplay is awesome.. the puzzles are nice and the post-apocalyptic feel of it all gets me excited even more than it did in portal one.. It is so many years later, you can really see how much time has worn out the facility. You can almost feel it! The small details really got me going, damaged levels that are fixed up just so you can complete the 'tests'. In the beginning up in the higher levels, all the plants and the occasional bird chirping through the broken roof... and more hiding spots- made by you know who! The grandness of some of the area's, and the auto recordings etc that let you know what happened there.. (also, try listening to the prerecorded messages entirely if you have not yet done that, they are not only informative but also very funny at times!) Anyway, if you played portal 1 but not portal 2? Stop reading this and go play it, No seriously! play it.. you can play through it in a day, and you will be so sorry it is over.. If you haven't played portal 1 and are still reading this, Go play portal one! Love the hell out of it, and than go play 2 and be sad when its over.... And pray with me for a portal-3 how ever unlikely that seems.



- Spoiler alert!-



I really liked how GlaDos is SO much more cynical and real than in the first edition, and i really got a good laugh out of Miss Potato head! xD
Крутая игра

I am notoriously difficult to impress. Most games, even the absolute best ones, I merely pick at for a few hours here and there until they're done, and it's extremely rare that I actually go back and play something a second time. Portal 2 however?

Wheatley and GLaDOS have moments of real hilarity in their dialogue and the story is a good one. The puzzles are fun and interesting and the inclusion of new elements that Portal didn't have, the orange and blue gels make for some really interesting tests. I played it all the way through in one go. Then I did the co-op puzzles with a friend. A few community made tests later, I was back in for a second playthrough...

It leaves you wanting more. 

I highly recommend this game, and I'm also seriously hoping for a Portal 3. Because even though the community tests make for a theoretically infinite amount of puzzles, they're not quite the same thing.

Hi! You're here to see if I recommend Portal 2. I DO! ALOT.
Not only the singleplayer of this game is full of surprises and fun stuff.
But the co-op made me find my best friend. If you randomly pass by on 'Play with a partner online' you may find yourself a new friend... I sure did. We almost play all the time and it's heck fun.
Play the singleplayer first then if you want an extra hit do co-op :D Almost played all the maps and I love it. Unfortunally you may also find 20 year olds on Portal 2 who have have a voice of a pedophile. Just sayiing. I once met a 35 year old Professor on Portal 2 Co-op hahah.
Anyways, recommend the shit out of this game. PLEASE BUY IT. NOW. I AM NOT GABEN.

Первый Portal мне подарили и играть я в него начал с не охотой, ради интереса. И мой интерес меня не подвел. Подобных игр я на тот момент не встречал, хоть и сюжет не совсем был понятен и цели прохождения уровней, к концу сюжета Portal вся суть была донесена, но все же остались вопросы и возникло большое желание поиграть в Portal 2. Приобрел его на распродаже со скидкой 75% не задумываясь и не жалею, так как игра принесла только одно удовольствие. Был полностью раскрыт сюжет головоломки не напрягали, достойная прорисовка уровней, история создания лаборатории была раскрыта по ходу прохождения, харизматичные герои которых невольно цитируешь после прохождения. В общем есть игры на 1 раз, а есть игры, которые переиграть так и тянет, так вот Portal 2, одна из тех игр, которые переигрываешь несколько раз. Кооператив Portal 2 также принес много удовольствия. Даже играя с незнакомым человеком и даже если вы говорите на разных языках, игра не становится менее интереснее, а на оборот, так как в ход вступает не голосовая связь, а связь жестами. Portal 2 занесена в мой список лучших игр, которые я играл. Рекомендую!

I've been playing computer games for over a quarter of a century, and they simply do not come better than this. The only negative element in my whole experience with the game so far is the fact that I bought it on a Steam special and now feel terrible that I didn't pay more!

It's such a rare joy to come across a game that actually treats the player with respect and intelligence, whilst providing lots and lots and lots of fun. I'm off to play it again...

9.99/10

Being much longer than the first installment, it does its best to continue the humor. But inevitably becomes a bit stale in comparison to Portal 1. The single player puzzles are quite easy. Which is a shame, because it's the whole point of the game. I never got stumped on any challenge in story mode. The coop mode however gives much more of a challenge. Besides that, it's endless fun shooting away light bridges from under your coop partner while hovering over a giant pit of death. Be sure to play with a friend who can take a joke and make sure you can too.
The addition of the Workshop allows you to endlessly download user created puzzles, giving the game a huge amount of content.

Brilliant, perfectly-crafted game packed with hilariously satirical dialogues. A definite masterpiece from Valve, highly recommended for those who seeks for a combination of a First Person Shooter and Puzzle.
